intro: Vittadinia brachycomoides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved everlasting, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Compositae (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers that are typically yellow or pink in color. The plant has hairy, narrow leaves and is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It is known for its ability to thrive in arid conditions and is considered a hardy, drought-tolerant species.
